metadata.title: CVE-2024-0646 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™sTransport Layer Security functionality in how a user calls a functionsplice with a ktls socket as the destination. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-21-generic - 6.5.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-21-generic - 6.5.0-21.21

No subscription required
